intro: Nananthus setifer, commonly known as the hairy nananthus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are typically pink or purple and are clustered in inflorescences. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
